title: Dancing On Ice's H shares 'happiness' after landing same-sex partner to make TV history
text:

Dancing On Ice star Ian 'H' Watkins has shared his "happiness" after news broke that he's getting a same-sex partner for the new series.

The former Steps star, who is openly gay, will reportedly be paired with Matt Evers , the skater who previously danced with Gemma Colllins.

He has been hard at work training, and today he returned to social media to share a selfie with show judges Jayne Torvill and Christopher Dean.

In a banner across the snap, he wrote: "Happiness".

H also shared a video of himself on the ice laughing as he fluffed his moves.

In a post on Instagram , he wrote: "I mean... @dancingonice training is getting ridiculously funny!!!"

(Image: Instagram)

H is said to had asked Dancing On Ice producers whether he could be paired with a male skater and the team were "fully supportive" of it.

A Dancing On Ice source told The Sun : “After conversations with the Dancing on Ice production team, H enquired as to the possibility of being paired with a male pro skater.

“Bosses at Dancing on Ice are fully supportive of a same-sex partnership, so this year H will be paired with Matt.

(Image: Instagram)

(Image: Instagram)

“It’s a huge moment in TV history. A lot of viewers will be watching and the hope is it might set a trend.”

The move means DOI bosses have pipped their rivals at BBC show Strictly Come Dancing to land the first same-sex couple on a dance show.

A BBC spokesman said this year: "We are completely open to the prospect of same-sex pairings between celebrities and pro dancers [on Strictly] in the future, should the opportunity arise.”
